channel.title: Sdk on Archive of FeedHenry Developer Blog 2012-2016
channel.description: Recent content in Sdk on Archive of FeedHenry Developer Blog 2012-2016

item.title: Announcing the FeedHenry C#/.NET Native SDK for Windows Phone and Xamarin
item.description:
If you are a .NET developer, you can now use our .NET SDK to develop native cross-platform cloud-connected apps. It can be used to develop Windows Phone 8+ apps (using Visual Studio) as well as iOS and Android apps (using Xamarin Studio). The SDK is open source and available here on GitHub. It can be downloaded via the NuGet .NET package management system here.

We have an introduction to the .NET SDK, and all of our SDKs on our docs site. You can then read the .NET SDK usage guide and finally dig into the details with our .NET SDK and Xamarin tutorial.

Once you’ve done all the reading, you can get your hands dirty with our Xamarin Team To-Do Sample App which uses the same Cloud code as our Team To-Do Cordova/Backbone App.
